trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides a generic view of a sequence of bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx x xxxxxxx xxxx xx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This is an abstract class.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A Stream with no backing store.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X $xxxxxx$Xxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the stream supports reading; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the stream supports seeking; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value that determines whether the current stream can time out.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A value that determines whether the current stream can time out.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the stream supports writing; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, gets the length in bytes of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A long value representing the length of the stream in bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A class derived from Stream does not support seeking.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx $xxxxxx$Xxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the position within the current stream.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream does not support seeking.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets a value, in miliseconds, that determines how long the stream will attempt to read before timing out.

trans-unit.source:
\n

-or-

destination does not support writing.

trans-unit.source: This value must be greater than zero.

trans-unit.source:
The default size is 81920.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An array of bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ $ $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ $ 0$ xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxx $0$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\nbuffer is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\noffset or count is negative.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs.

\n

The stream does not support reading.

Methods were called after the stream was closed.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

The buffer to write the data into.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data from the stream.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to read.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx xx xxx xx 0 $xxxx$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.

trans-unit.source:
\n

A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The new position within the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream does not support seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxx xx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream does not support both writing and seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx$ xxxx xx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Methods were called after the stream was closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An array of bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of offset and count is greater than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx$$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx$$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: buffer is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: offset or count is negative.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx$$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occured, such as the specified file cannot be found.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream does not support writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.

\n

\n

The buffer to write data from.

\n

\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to write.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

\n

trans-unit.source: buffer is null.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream does not support writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream has been disposed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is currently in use by a previous write operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

\n

The buffer to write data from.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to write.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

\n

\n

\n

The stream does not support writing.

\n

The stream has been disposed.

\n

The stream is currently in use by a previous write operation.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

trans-unit.source:
\n
